result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davonte Capre Harris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Davonte Capre Harris appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Davonte Capre Harris.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for an arraignment. Original information filed.  Copy given to Defense Counsel who acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, and plead not guilty on behalf of Mr. Harris.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery and offer and requests a projected guilty plea date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Davonte Capre Harris not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Davonte Capre Harris.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defense needs discovery and an offer. Case has not yet had an arraignment. Case is adjourned.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Arraignment scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Davonte Capre Harris in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Davonte Capre Harris in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. State requests an arraignment date. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Arraignment scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Davonte Capre Harris not in court, defendant in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Davonte Capre Harris in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Davonte Capre Harris in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
